metadata.title: Price Dispersion in Farmland Markets: What is the Role of Asymmetric Information?
metadata.publisher: Wiley Periodicals LLC on behalf of Agricultural & Applied Economics Association

data_sources.source_name: Committee of Land Valuation Experts of Saxony-Anhalt
data_sources.description: The dataset consists of 12,134 land market transactions for arable land in Saxony-Anhalt from 2014 to 2017. It includes transaction details such as contract date, price, lot characteristics (location, size, soil quality index), and anonymous agent-type information. The data was used to analyze the role of asymmetric information in farmland price formation, focusing on the effects of buyer and seller characteristics on price dispersion.
data_sources.access_conditions: Provided by the Committee of Land Valuation Experts of Saxony-Anhalt

assessment.findability_reason: The dataset is mentioned in the publication but lacks a direct link or DOI for easy access.
assessment.accessibility_reason: The data is provided by a specific committee and may require permission to access.
assessment.interoperability_reason: The data format and standards are not specified, limiting interoperability.
assessment.reusability_reason: The dataset is specific to the study and may have limited reusability without additional context or access permissions.
